Shyrley

PS Susan, why ain't your IM turned on? We've mmissed you :-(

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] not quite 20 questions
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m on in the early mornings, dear, when you are still sleeping :-)  By the time you are up, we re hot into the day.  You forget what having a 5yo is like,
messages.messageBody:
Shyrley <shyrley.williams@...> wrote:

>Yeah, you need the Brit sit-coms that haven't been shown in >America :-)

>Shyrley

>PS Susan, why ain't your IM turned on? We've mmissed you :-(



I'm on in the early mornings, dear, when you are still sleeping :-) By the time you are up, we're hot into the day. You forget what having a 5yo is like, I suppose.

Otherwise I just pop on to check e-mail when I get a chance. The rain this week has cancelled soccer practice, so I have actually had time to read the e-mails!

SusanM.





---------------------------------

It got Mork when it asked me if I drank with my finger...

messages.subject: not quite 20 questions
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/9/03 12:46:58 PM, mc1mommy@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/9/03 12:46:58 PM, mc1mommy@... writes:

<< http://www.smalltime.com/dictator.html

Here's the correct link. Sorry about that. So many windows, so little time.
>>

I kept playing with it. It's not quite 20 questions, because the order in
which the questions is asked seems pretty random and disorganized, but it was
still interesting and Holly (not home today) is going to really have fun with
it. Easy, short reading and good thinking!

Once it asked me are you in Florida
Do you live in England
Are you English

But not all lined up that way, scattered with other stuff.

And these two came once right in a row, which amused me:

Do you live in Texas?
Did you come back from the dead?

Sandra
